page.title: 03The Church In Shrivenham
page.content: Shrivenham Church dates back to the time of the last Domesday Book.They get between 50-80 people attending the family service and about 75-90 people at the main service.The congregation at the main service is made up of people of all ages.People come from Swindon and Watchfield but they mainly come from Shrivenham. It costs about 300 pounds a week to run the church.The Parish pays a share of about 9,000 pounds towards the vicar. The vicar's noticed many changes over the years.One of them is that more people share the churches work. The most frequent ceremony in the week is the Holy Communion Service which is when people take the Bread and Wine.Some people who haven't been Confirmed are blessed by the vicar.Confirmation is when you renew
